history.content:
Would you like to become a CS peer advisor? CS Peer Advisors (PA) provide basic advising, motivation, and support to CS-intended and declared CS students. PA’s serve as a resource and connect their peers to information about declaration and major requirements, enrolling in CS classes, signing up for on campus tutoring, finding internship and research opportunities, participating in student organizations, and more!

We believe that a student's perspective is valuable in helping other students make decisions about life at Cal. For this reason, Peer Advisors serve as ambassadors for Computer Science when meeting with students and prospective families. Additionally, PA’s assist with a number of undergraduate events, as well as assists in the development of new student programming.

About

This is an unpaid position. For at least the fall semester, peer advisors will be remote/on campus if they wish to be. The peer advisor will be expected to be available for remote advising appointments with current and prospective students. The ideal candidate for this position will be available to work 3-6 hours per week during the academic year. The benefits of being a Peer Advisor include:

  • Hands-on experience and opportunity to develop leadership skills
  • Communication and problem-solving skills development
  • Can gain 1 or 2-units of academic credit (CS 197)


Duties & Responsibilities

  • Guide prospective students and families through the CS major declaration process and course options.
  • Develop and maintain a strong working knowledge of and be able to advise students on basic academic policies and procedures, internship and research opportunities, and CS academic resources.
  • Plan one Peer advising event each semester on course planning prior to/during phase 1.
  • Assist with the planning and coordination of student programs and events such as CS Ed Day, Transfer Day, Cal Day, CS Scholars Kick-off, and other outreach events.
  • Assist advisors with collecting and compiling information for administrative and data reports.  
  • Monitor and respond to online inquiries via email.
  • Attend mandatory check-ins.


Eligibility

  • Open for UC Berkeley students declared in a major or minor related to CS
  • Must attend two check-in meetings each month with the peer advisor coordinator (CS major advisor)
  • Commitment to volunteer at least 3 hours a week for the fall and spring semesters
  • Must be in good academic standing with at least a 2.5 GPA
  • Excellent interpersonal communication and writing skills
  • Ability to relate effectively with groups and individuals from diverse backgrounds
  • Highly reliable; timely to shifts, meetings and with deadlines
  • Maintain confidentiality, discretion and objectivity in all matters related to LSCS
  • Submit resume

Application timeline:

  • First review - August 9th
  • CS Peer Advising Interviews - rolling basis
  • Decisions made and deadline to accept - by August 20th
  • Training & orientation - Week of August 25th (exact time and date TBD) Please complete this application thoroughly to be considered for the CS Peer Advisor interview.

Questions?
Contact - leslie.mach@berkeley.edu

Apply Now
